pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:5.1: 74. The training rule on defecating on cultivated plants
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were defecating, urinating, and spitting on cultivated plants. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:7.1: “‘When not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit on cultivated plants,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:8.1: If one is not sick, one should not defecate, urinate, or spit on cultivated plants.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:8.2: If, out of disrespect, a monk who is not sick defecates, urinates, or spits on cultivated plants, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:10.1: The fourteenth training rule is finished.
